section.title: p:set-properties
section.para: The p:set-properties step sets document properties on the source document.

The document properties of the document on the source port are augmented with the values specified in the properties option. The document produced on the result port has the same representation but the adjusted property values.

If the merge option is true, then the supplied properties are added to the existing properties, overwriting already existing values for a given key. If it is false, the document’s properties are replaced by the new set.

para.error: It is a dynamic error if a value is assigned to the serialization document property that cannot be converted into map(xs:QName, item()*) according to the rules in section “QName handling” of .
It is a dynamic error if the properties map contains a key equal to the string “content-type”.

section.para: If the properties map contains a key equal to the string “base-uri” the associated value is taken as the new base URI of the resulting document. It is a dynamic error if the base URI is not both absolute and valid according to .

simplesect.title: Document properties
simplesect.para: If merge is true, document properties not overridden by settings in the properties map are preserved, otherwise the resulting document has only the content-type property and the properties specified in the properties map. In particular, if merge is false, the base-uri property will not be preserved. This means that the resulting document will not have a base URI if the properties map does not contain a base-uri entry.
